main event: A bright, pulsating object was observed in the sky over Lincoln Park, Michigan on April 25, 1962.
interesting points: The object was approximately 500-600 feet in diameter and emitted a brilliant blue-white light that appeared to pulsate., The sighting lasted for 7-8 minutes and was tracked on FAA radar., The object was confirmed by other observers in the area., The estimated speed of the object was reported to be around 1700 M.P.H., There were multiple previous sightings of similar objects in the area since at least 1959.
witness description: One witness was a 29-year-old male physicist with some training in observations of cosmic energy and nuclear reactions.
